title: Check if providers could provide an alternative url to point user to where to get credentials
body:
use case: http://github.com/conpdatasets/preventad-open

has
```
$> cat .datalad/providers/loris.cfg       
[provider:loris-prevent-ad]
url_re = https:\/\/openpreventad.loris.ca\/.*
credential = loris-prevent-ad
authentication_type = loris-token
loris-token_failure_re = "User not authenticated"}$

[credential:loris-prevent-ad]
url = https://openpreventad.loris.ca/api/v0.0.3-dev/login
type = loris-token
```
which leads to
```
$> git annex get preventad_5458966_NAPFU12_bold_002.mnc
get preventad_5458966_NAPFU12_bold_002.mnc (from datalad...) 
[INFO] Downloading 'https://openpreventad.loris.ca/api/v0.0.3-dev/candidates/5458966/NAPFU12/images/preventad_5458966_NAPFU12_bold_002.mnc' into '.git/annex/tmp/MD5E-s23636657--ed08ec2d2c5402baac5615f6a918096f.mnc' 
[INFO] http session: Authenticating into session for https://openpreventad.loris.ca/api/v0.0.3-dev/candidates/5458966/NAPFU12/images/preventad_5458966_NAPFU12_bold_002.mnc 
You need to authenticate with 'loris-prevent-ad' credentials. https://openpreventad.loris.ca/api/v0.0.3-dev/login provides information on how to gain access
user: 
```
but user needs to go to https://openpreventad.loris.ca not api/v0.0.3-dev/login of it to register. I guess `url` here is the programmable end-point
